examples.title: Require one of multiple checkboxes
examples.description:
Require one checkbox out of many to be checked.
Uses a tab_group.

examples.title: Required checkbox
examples.description:
Require a checkbox to be checked.
Uses a tab_group.

examples.title: HTML document
examples.description: Uses an HTML source document with full_name, email_address, and sign_here fields (tabs).

examples.title: Reminder
examples.description: A remote signer (email invitation) with the reminder setting controlled by the API request, not by the account's defaults.

examples.title: Access Code
examples.description: A shared secret between the signer and the sender acts to authenticate the signer since no one else knows the secret (the access code).

examples.title: ID Verify
examples.description: Uses DocuSign ID Verify feature to verify the signer's government-issued ID.

examples.title: KBA Authentication
examples.description: KBA -- Knowledge Based Authentication. To pass the authentication step, the signer must enter their address information. The signer is then asked a series of questions to authenticate their identity. This service is not available for all countries.

examples.title: Phone Authentication
examples.description: To pass the authentication step, the signer must receive a phone call and then enter the access code that is given during the call.

examples.title: SMS authentication
examples.description: Sends a SMS message to verify the signer has access to receive SMS messages at a previously agreed phone number.

examples.title: Witness
examples.description: During the Signing Ceremony, the signer is asked for the name and email of their witness. The witness is then sent an email invitation to sign the envelope as a witness to the original signer's signature.
